title: For Trade:  SOLD
location: Temple Area - Will Drive, Austin, Texas
postcontent:
On 03 May I purchased a new Saiga 7.62x39 20" from http://www.classicfirearms.co , unconverted.
I called the owner and requested that he pull one and examine the chamber. Some 7.62x39 Saigas have a stepped chamber ( http://i50.tinypic.com/2myqdyo.jpg , http://forum.saiga-12.com/uploads/monthly_05_2010/post-22REDACTED3739608_thumb.jpg ) which the Russian government requires for civilian rifles, to help identify the weapon used during a crime from the small swell it leaves in the case neck. The owner inspected one and assured me that the chamber step was not there.
The firearm arrived today and it turns out the dealer lied to me.

I am a reloader and licensed ammunition manufacturer, and while the brass can be reloaded, sizing it to such an extent reduces the number of times a piece can be reloaded. Stepped chambers do not affect the function of the rifle, and can even help in chambering cheap or surplus ammunition. This is not an issue for people who only plan to shoot cheap steel-cased ammo or those who do not reload at all.

I have not fired this rifle. I have only done a quick field strip and shone a flashlight into the chamber. It is new in the box with all accompanying parts, bags and paperwork.

title: For Sale:  German (Schmeisser) MP40 MP-40 Mp 40 Parts Kit
location: York, Lancaster, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, United States
postcontent:
Here is a German (Also called/known as "Schmeisser") MP40 Parts/Kit for sale (for states that it's legal in, you have to check). NO FFL REQUIRED! For an additional $100-$200 you can buy a Legal 80% receiver to make it a Legal display Machine Gun/Pistol. A class 2 dealer could make it totally back to its original fully functional state. Then it would be worth $15k-$30k to a C&R.

This one still has the front 3rd of receiver with trunion still attached.  

It's from one of 229,833 made in 1942 (FXO 42), by contractor C.G. Haenel, sub-contractor C.O.S Werz Werk. If the information is correct, it is number 867 of the 66,300 issued to the Luftwaffe Air Force (Based on the Eagles Stamped on it, Waffen Marks) that year. Made for the German Third Reich.

ALL numbers are the same throughout, except the trigger group housing on the lower receiver and the folding stock, #'s 890 of/for the same.

Also has the WaA marks.

It has the Original shoulder strap as well as one clip. The clip (for states that it is legal in, you have to check) has the MP38u40 stamped in/on it.

Rifiling in barrell still looks to be in very good condition. NO Rust or Pitting Anywhere. All other parts show normal wear and tear for its age, with NO cracks. I'd rate it at 90%+.

These are getting harder and harder to find! And they ain't getting cheaper!

If you are interested in it, please let me know. Make a reasonable offer. NO Low Balls! Thanks! Take Care!

Ron
Cell: REDACTED

title: For Sale:  Urban Escape
location: Clayton, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
URBAN ESCAPE
GETTING OUT AND GETTING HOME

First Weekend (Basic) $140 - June 16 and 17
Mind Set to Survive, Area Disasters and How to Survive Them, Get home bag (GHB), Bug out bag (BOB) and Everyday Carry (EDC), Color Codes of Awareness, Stay or Go, Ropes and Knots, Land Navigation and Tracking/Counter tracking.

Second Weekend (Advance) $180 - July 14 and 15
(Must have completed the basic class)
Evasion Tec, Bush Craft (Fire, Water and Shelter) and Test  

At the end of this block of instruction you will be tested on what you have learned by surviving for one night on streets. You will evade capture by moving and navigating to a series of check points and then on to sanctuary. During this part of the class you will be hunted, you will not know who they are but they will know who you are, you must avoid being tagged or captured. These hunters are former military, police and search and rescue, they have been through this course. They are well rested, fed and ready to go and to make it even worst for you, I have place a bounty on each and every one of you, they are only payed if they find you.  You are considered tagged if they come within 30 feet of you and captured if they get within 6 feet. Tagging you lose 5 points and you need 80 points to pass. Captured and you will start over. You have 12 hours to go 12 miles. No cars, no cell phones and no help from anyone outside of the class.

Are you ready?

title: For Sale:  Remington 308
postcontent: I have a custom remington 700 .308 sniper rifle. The gun has a bell & carlson stock with a full length aluminum bedding system. The stock also has a custom monpod installed by me. Upgraded the trigger to a rifle basix. The trigger is adjustable from 8oz-20oz. I have it set right at 16oz. The trigger has three diffrent kinds of adjustment, weight of pull, creep and sear.  This gun has a 20 MOA base and burris 30 mm rings. The scope is a vortex viper pst    6-24x50. scope has a 30 mm tube and a EBR 1 MOA (enhanced battle reticle). Basically this is the best reticle for the long range shooter. When the scope is on 24 power the distance between mils is always 1 MOA. if its on 12 power the distance is 2 moa, and so on all the way to 6 power. Scope is zeroed in at 200 yards and turrets are reset. I have 43 MOA of elevation left to adjust for. That will take me out to 1100 yards without using my reticle! I have a custom load worked up for this gun that will average .330 MOA at 100 yards . My load is 43g of varget with lapua brass trimmed to 2.005, federal 210 match primers, 175 sierra match king bullets seated .015 off my lands. With this load my muzzle velocity is 2580. With my ballistics coeffecient and that muzzle velocity my bullet will stay supersonic all the way out to 1100 yards then go subsonic. I built this gun for longrange 1000 yard competion. I have over 2500 in this gun and thats not counting all the months of load testing. Im asking 1750 OBO call or txt for more info. I can send more pics of the gun including 5 shot groups TXT offers REDACTED

title: For Sale:  1944 91/30 Mosin nagant - EX SNIPER
location: knightdale, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
1944 Izhevsk 91/30 ex PU sniper rifle.
All numbers stamped matching, deep crisp marking(Rare Diamond 88 triangle),excellent finish, excellent bore. Has the ORIGINAL sniper trigger to this rifle which is extremely rare(second one I have seen). Scope number on side of barrel. Comes with cleaning rod.

At the end of the war the soviets had over 200,000 sniper rifles and little use for them. For reasons including expense and no need for fielding that many snipers they returned them to infantry format. Removed the scopes/mounts/bases, plugged the base holes and welded over them. They replaced the bent bolt handles with straight standard bolt handles and repaired or replaced the stock.

For more info on 91/30s and other WW2 Bolt Actions please see this thread
http://www.carolinashootersclub.com/threads/808-%E2%99%A0%E2%99%A0-Bolt-Actions-of-WWII-%E2%99%A0%E2%99%A0-Arsenals-FAQs-and-Field-Stripping!
This one has had a very interesting history and having the original sniper trigger/sear makes it worth more than most other 91/30 ex snipers you could find or buy.
$170, cash. Cant ship as I am out of boxes.

title: For Sale:  9mm Pistole 08 (P08) Luger (Replica cap firing model / Prop gun) Japan Made
postcontent:
,Made in Japan
Operating principle: Cap firing model gun, PFC
Full size fully functional and field strippable REPLICA. 
This is Plug Fire Cartridge (PFC) replica gun that has real-like firing effect complete with muzzle flash, ejecting shell (NOT A PROJECTILE GUN) , gun powder smoke, recoil and firing sound. 

9mm P08 was specifically made for the German Army in the early 20th century and it was based on model made first for German Navy. The unofficial Luger name originates from salesman George Luger who played a part in designing of the gun. P08 was a standard sidearm for German troops in World War I and it continued to serve until end of World War Two. In time period between WWI and WWII Luger P08 was manufactured in non-standard 7.65mm caliber due limitations placed in Treaty of Versailles. Normally Luger P08s were manufactured in 9 x 19mm Parabellum caliber. 

Luger P08 has a unique upwards-opening, toggle-locking mechanism that gives its unique sleek appearance. Its drawback was a exposure to elements that made it high-maintenance gun design. 

Model Gun Luger P08 PFC technical details: 

Caliber: 9mm
Length: 217mm
Barrel length: 4 inches
Weight: 580g
Ammunition: 5mm cap
Materials: Metal and ABS plastic
Magazine capacity: 8 cartridges

Included with the gun: Just gun

Q&A:

Is this an firearm?
PFC model guns are in most countries legal to own and donft require license for ownership. PFC model guns cannot shoot projectiles and will only fire plug fire cartridges that create movie-like muzzle flash and firing smoke while empty shell is ejected. Depending of the gun size there maybe also recoil. No projectile of any sort is fired, so these model guns are used primarily for display, re-enactment, recreational or movie propping purposes. You can recognize our plug fire cartridge model guns from dummy model guns from operating principle explanations.

How does plug fire cartridge model guns fire?
The caps are positioned so that the internal ignition pin will ignite the cap when the PFC model gun is fired. Ready PFC cartridges are loaded in the magazine like the real thing and magazine capacity is usually identical with real counterpart. PFC model guns are cocked the same way as their real counterparts.

How realistic are model guns?
The details and functionality of model guns imitates the real counterparts very closely while still keeping things safe and fun. Best of our models are used for war museum display, living history and movie productions. Model guns are realistic reproductions that suit WWII buffs, collectors and re-enactment hobbyists a like!

Located @
Blades For Life
571 Stone Rd.
Rochester, NY, 14616
REDACTED

title: For Sale/Trade:  1953 Polish M44 Mosin Nagant
postcontent:
For sale is a very early Polish M44 Mosin Nagant carbine.  It is made with leftover Soviet parts and is complete with bayonet, cleaning rod, and 91/30 sling.  The Polish-made carbines are known for their excellent fit and finish as well as their scarcity compared to other M44 variants.  

It is not a refurb so the metal and wood show honest wear, but no damage.  The bore has very strong rifling and very light pitting (very common as these shoot corrosive military ammunition).  

The bolt does not match, but everything else does.  It is a good shooter but the front sight may need to be adjusted as its hash marks and peening does not mate (it may just be a replacement from another rifle).  

Please email or call me at REDACTED to set up a time to inspect the rifle or make an offer on it.

I am open to trades, preferably a pump action shotgun but I'm open to offers.

===============================================

===============================================

Video review: http://youtu.be/A9mpThuj-WQ

SUMMARY:
This Ad is for a Brand New/Never Been Fired Safir Arms T14 AR-15 Upper receiver with accessories. Safir Arms' previous uppers featured carbine and rifle-length plastic M16 style hand guards whereas this one uses a complete aluminum QUAD-RAIL!

FITS ON ANY MILSPEC AR-15 LOWER
This is a complete AR-15 upper receiver chambered .410ga 2.5" shot shell, and can be used with any standard milspec lower to turn your AR15 into a semi-automatic shotgun! 

AD IS FOR UPPER RECEIVER ONLY
This item is the UPPER RECEIVER ONLY, not a complete firearm, but all you need to do is attach this upper to your existing AR-15 lower. There are a number of good quality upper receivers for less than $300 available, some examples include Stag Arms, Palmetto State Armory, giving you a complete semi-automatic shotgun for around the same cost as a standard AR-15 chambered in .223.

title: For Sale:  TANGO DOWN BattleGrip Quick Detach Short Vertical Grip BLACK
postcontent:
CALL OR TEXT REDACTED



Battlegrip Model BGV-QDK

After years of searching for the ultimate Quick Detach method for our vertical grips, TangoDown has teamed with American Defense to bring you the best vertical grip yet.

Some weapon systems and mission profiles require a quick detach/attach method for vertical grips and other components. Ideally, this design would require a wide range of adjustment to fit MIL-STD spec and out-of-spec rails. It would also require no tools for rapid, accurate adjustment in the harshest field conditions. It would also be bombproof and light as possible.

That grip is now available. The BGV-QD series vertical grip.. the latest evolution of our combat-tested and proven BGV-series of vertical grips.

The BGV-QD series features an ADM U.S. Patent Pending throw lever system that is steps above anything else available to operators. First, the throw lever locks in place when installed, and cannot be inadvertently unlocked, if caught on web gear, slings, etc. A simple push button releases the throw lever from the locked position allowing lightning fast attachment or removal when you decide.

Next, the adjustment system for fitting ANY type of rail, from authentic MIL-STD 1913 to commercial Weaver type is KISS compliant. Adjustment is accomplished in a flash, with no tools. It is simple, elegant, light and strong. No more fumbling for wrenches that mayor- may not be in your kit while youre on a mountain top in Afghanistan. All hardware is TYPE III hard coat anodized, or given an anti-glare black Melonite coating for superior corrosion protection.

The BGV-QD series grips still feature the best heat and impact modified polymers that money can buy. Our proprietary formulated resins take combat abuse in stride, and complete the mission every time without fracturing or shattering from impact, common with some other brands. All BGV series grips are injection molded from fiberglass-reinforced resin, not machined from un-reinforced brittle delrin, for the utmost in strength. Our grips are designed for use on M4s all the way to 7.62mm belt fed SAWs, and routinely pass 6 drop tests on these weapon systems. The BGV-MK46 vertical grip is one of only two vertical grips in the US Military inventory, awarded NSN # 1010-01-536-4707.

BGV-QD series grips also retain our O- ring protected internal storage cavity, good for depths of 66 feet. This cavity allows for easy access storage of weapon spares, batteries and other combat essential items. 

The BGV-QDK grip is the optimum choice for breaching shotguns, M4s, CQB systems such as the MK18..any system requiring a compact envelope. The shorter length also lends itself to vehicle use, or tight operating environments. The BGV-QDK is available in black, flat dark earth and foliage green.

As always, every Tangodown product is proudly designed, tooled and produced here in the United States of America. Our mission still remains to provide the finest possible kit to the U.S. Warfighter.

Gas piston Sig 516-16 Upper.  Puchased by me directly from Sig Sauer about one year ago.  The POF lower is VERY difficult to find; new or used, and is VERY expensive. A new POF lower is typically $900 and OUT OF STOCK.

http://www.pof-usa.com/

http://www.cflgunandtactical.com/servlet/the-32/POF-USA-P415-FACTORY/Detail

The manufacturing date of the complete lower is 4/30/2010.  All POF lower receivers are machined from 7075 aluminum, and are MilSpec type III hard coat anodized.  They have a flaired magwell for speed loads.

The manufacturing date of the SIG US516-16 upper is 4/13/2011.  SIG SAUER advanced short-stroke pushrod system. This advanced operating system reduces carbon fouling, excessive heat and unburned powder in the action, ensuring reliability and function that is unmatched. A standard 5.56mm NATO chrome-lined chamber and bore ensure reliable function in any environment.
Features a free-floating, aluminum, M1913 quad rail and 1:7 right-hand twist bore configuration.

An adjustable gas valve allows operators to increase the flow of gas when using lower pressure ammunition or when adverse conditions require additional energy. Reduced flow and the off-position enhance the use of suppressors. Barrels feature an A2 flash suppressor and are threaded x28 TPI, allowing the SIG516 to adapt to a number of aftermarket accessories and suppressor mounts.

Gunbroker ad starting bid $1,200

I will be listing this on paid sites so this is subject to prior sale.
